What is the supreme law of the Socialist: The Constitution is the fundamental and supreme law of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam; all other legal documents must conform to the Constitution.
Who is the leading force of the State an: The Communist Party of Vietnam is the leading force of the State and society.
To whom does all state power belong?: All state power belongs to the People, based on the alliance between the working class, the peasantry, and the intelligentsia.
What is the role of the National Assembl: The National Assembly is the highest representative body of the People and the highest body of state power, exercising constitutional and legislative powers.
Who is the Head of State and what is the: The President is the Head of State, representing the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in domestic and foreign affairs.
What is the definition of the Government: The Government is the highest administrative body of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, exercising executive power, and is the executive organ of the National Assembly.
Which bodies exercise judicial power?: The People's Courts are the judicial bodies of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam and exercise judicial power.
What is the function of the State Audit: The State Audit Office is the agency established by the National Assembly to independently audit the management and use of public finance and public assets.
Who has the right to vote and stand for: Citizens who are eighteen years of age or older have the right to vote, and citizens who are twenty-one years of age or older have the right to stand for election to the National Assembly and People's Councils.
How can the Constitution be amended?: The Constitution is amended upon the proposal of the President, the National Assembly Standing Committee, the Government, or at least one-third of the total number of National Assembly deputies, and must be approved by at least two-thirds of the deputies.
